In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function `wrap_string` in Julia, which wraps the input string at every `text_width`:

```julia
function wrap_string(input::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input, " ")
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            println(result)
            result = ""
        end
        result *= (length(result) == 0 ? "" : " ") * word
    end
    println(result) # Print the remaining part
end
```

You can test this function with an example as:

```julia
wrap_string("This is a sample text for wrapping. It will wrap at every given width.")
```

The output would be:
```
"This is a 
sample 
text for 
wrapping. 
It will 
wrap at 
every given 
width."
```
